noidung: Which of the following best defines management?
a: The process of working with and through people to achieve organizational goals efficiently and effectively
b: The process of buying and selling goods in a market
c: The process of hiring employees only for operational tasks
d: The process of controlling only financial activities

noidung: In the context of business, management primarily involves:
Which phrase is most accurate about management?
a: It is an ongoing process of planning, organizing, leading, and controlling
b: It is a one-time activity done at the start of a project
c: It focuses only on supervising workers
d: It is the art of avoiding risks

noidung: Management can be described as:
a: The science and art of getting things done through people
b: The manipulation of resources for personal gain
c: The sole responsibility of the company’s CEO
d: The process of producing raw materials

noidung: Which of the following is NOT part of the definition of management?

Arranging tasks, people, and resources to accomplish work describes which management function?
Motivating, directing, and otherwise influencing people to work hard to achieve the organization’s goals is called:
Which management function is primarily concerned with monitoring performance and taking corrective action when needed?

This is an example of an influence from the:

This is an influence from the:

The ability to view the organization as a whole, recognize relationships between different parts, and understand its environment is called:
Which level of management requires the highest degree of conceptual skills?

Which level of management serves as a communication bridge between senior managers and junior managers?
When planning a company-wide restructuring, a manager anticipates market changes, evaluates risks, and understands how the decision affects all departments. This illustrates:

Ensuring that products meet safety standards and comply with government regulations demonstrates which CSR aspect?
A business chooses to pay fair wages and avoid exploiting workers, even when such practices are not legally required. This action reflects:
